alert.note: Alert for Bell; Knox (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 09 at 3:46PM EDT until August 09 at 6:00PM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 645 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southeast Kentucky, including the following counties, Bell and Knox. * WHEN...Until 645 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 344 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to slow-moving thunderstorms. Excessive rainfall will cause minor flooding of small streams and creeks, roads, and roadside culverts. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Pineville, Straight Creek, Cary, Arjay, East Pineville, Kettle Island, Ponza, Calvin, Wasioto, Varilla, Blanche, Miracle, Wallsend, Rella, Oaks, Fourmile, Hutch, Cubage, Elys and Shelaly.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
